items.title: Morgan Wallen, Garth Brooks, Taylor Swift & More Artists With Most Weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums Chart: FullÂ List
items.summary: Male solo artists dominate, though three female solo artists and two groups have also achieved the feat.
items.body: Morgan Wallen â€™s I’m the Problem leads Billboard ‘s Top Country Albums chart (dated Feb. 14) for the 37th nonconsecutive week. This ups Wallen’s career tally of weeks at No. 1 to 223, allowing him to extend his lead as the artist with the most weeks at No. 1 in the chart’s 62-year history. Wallenâ€™s achievement is especially impressive because he has amassed this hefty total of weeks at No. 1 in such a short amount of time. He first topped the chart on Aug. 15, 2020. Top Country Albums originated as Hot Country Albums in the Jan. 11, 1964 issue of Billboard . Johnny Cash â€™s Ring of Fire (The Best of Johnny Cash) headed the inaugural chart. The compilation was well-timed: â€œRing of Fireâ€ had headed Hot Country Songs for seven weeks the previous summer and had crossed over to reach the top 20 on the Billboard Hot 100. The chart was named Hot Country LPâ€™s from 1968 to 1984, when vinyl LPs were king. Twenty-one artists have logged 50 or more weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums. Male solo artists dominate, as you might expect, though three female solo artists have achieved the feat, as have two groups. (One of those groups is an all-female group.) Only one Black â€¦

items.title: 'Killjoy' - did VAR get late drama in Liverpool v Man City right?
items.summary: Manchester City's win at Liverpool ended in complete chaos - but did the referee and the VAR get Dominik Szoboszlai's red card right?

items.title: â€˜Wicked: For Goodâ€™ Tops $525 Million in Worldwide Grosses: Full List of Top-Grossing Film Adaptations of BroadwayÂ Musicals
items.summary: The smash sequel is just the third adaptation of a Broadway musical to top the $500 million mark.
items.body: Wicked: For Good has grossed $527.8 million worldwide in its first three months at the boxoffice, which puts it at No. 3 on Billboard â€™s list of the top-grossing films that are adapted from Broadway musicals. Our list is drawn from boxofficemojo.comâ€™s running tally of the 1,000 top-grossing films of all time in terms of worldwide grosses. Both Wicked: For Good and its predecessor, 2024â€™s Wicked , were adapted from the 2003 Broadway musical Wicked . The first Wicked film opened on Nov. 22, 2024. In just five weeks, it pulled ahead of Mamma Mia! to become the top-grossing film adapted from a Broadway musical. Wicked received 10 Oscar nominations on Jan. 23, 2025, including nods for both of its stars, Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande . It won two awards at the Oscars ceremony on March 2, 2025 â€” best costume design and best production design. Wicked: For Good was shut out in the nominations that were announced on Thursday Jan. 22. Both Wicked and Wicked: For Good were directed by Jon M. Chu, whose hit-studded rÃ©sumÃ© includes a previous film adaptation of a Broadway musical, the 2021 movie version of Lin-Manuel Miranda â€™s breakout hit In the Heights . Eight film adaptations of Broadway â€¦

items.title: Man City produce late comeback to beat Liverpool in chaotic finale
items.summary: Erling Haaland's 93rd-minute penalty gives Manchester City a crucial comeback win over Liverpool, who end the game with 10 men as Dominik Szoboszlai is sent off in stoppage time at Anfield.

items.title: Don Toliver Scores First No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 WithÂ â€˜OCTANEâ€™
items.summary: Plus, Bad Bunny flies 9-2 after the Grammys, while Noah Kahanâ€™s back in the top 10.
items.body: Don Toliver lands his first No. 1 album on the Billboard 200 chart as OCTANE starts atop the list dated Feb. 14. The set launches with 162,000 equivalent album units earned (his best week ever) in the United States in the week ending Feb. 5, according to Luminate. Plus, Bad Bunny â€™s DeBÃ TiRAR MÃ¡S FOToS jumps 9-2 after its album of the year win at the Grammy Awards on Feb. 1, while Noah Kahan â€™s Stick Season returns to the top 10 (rising 13-7) after the release of the lead single from his forthcoming album and the announcement of his tour. The Billboard 200 chart ranks the most popular albums of the week in the U.S. based on multi-metric consumption as measured in equivalent album units, compiled by Luminate. Units comprise album sales, track equivalent albums (TEA) and streaming equivalent albums (SEA). Each unit equals one album sale, or 10 individual tracks sold from an album, or 2,500 ad-supported or 1,000 paid/subscription on-demand official audio and video streams generated by songs from an album. The new Feb. 14, 2026-dated chart will be posted in full on Billboard ‘s website on Feb. 10. For all chart news, follow @billboard and @billboardcharts on both X and Instagraâ€¦

items.title: Crystal Palace end winless run with victory over rivals Brighton
items.summary: Ismaila Sarr scores the only goal of the game as Crystal Palace end a run of nine Premier League games without a win, by beating rivals Brighton 1-0 at the AMEX Stadium.

items.title: 'Experience told' in World Cup defeat - Stirling
items.summary: Ireland captain Paul Stirling says his side lacked a cutting edge in vital periods of the game as they lost by 20 runs to co-hosts Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup Group B opener.

items.title: Greg Brown, Founding Guitarist of Cake & â€˜The Distanceâ€™ Songwriter, Dies After â€˜BriefÂ Illnessâ€™
items.summary: The musician was featured on the bandâ€™s first two albums in the mid-1990s.
items.body: Greg Brown, founding guitarist of Cake and writer of the bandâ€™s hit song â€œThe Distance,â€ has died. Cake announced Brownâ€™s passing in a social media post on Saturday (Feb. 7). His age was not provided in the announcement, but a 2021 Billboard feature listed him as 51 at the time. Related Gone But Not Forgotten: Musicians We Lost in 2026 3 Doors Down Singer Brad Arnold Reveals Stage 4 Kidney Cancer Diagnosis: ‘I Have No Fear’ ‘Excess Ain’t Rebellion’: How Cake Has Made Moderation Sound Fun For the Past 30 Years “It is with heavy hearts that we share the news of Greg Brownâ€™s passing after a brief illness,” Cake wrote on Instagram alongside a black-and-white photo of their late bandmate. The Sacramento, Californiaâ€“based rock act â€” whose current members include vocalist John McCrea, trumpeter/keyboardist Vince DiFiore, guitarist Xan McCurdy, bassist Daniel McCallum and drummer Todd Roper â€” did not specify an exact cause of death. “Greg was an integral part of CAKEâ€™s early sound and development,” the group added. “His creative contributions were immense, and his presence â€” both musical and personal â€” will be deepâ€¦

items.title: Slot bemoans luck with referees in loss to Man City
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says the club have had poor luck with referees this season, believing that Marc Guehi should have been sent off for a challenge on Mohamed Salah in their loss to Manchester City.

items.title: 'England can't get carried away with big win over Wales'
items.summary: BBC Sport pundit Chris Ashton believes England have made a "great start" to the Six Nations, but warns they should not look at their 48-7 win over Wales as anything other than "a building block" for the rest of the tournament.

items.title: 3 Doors Downâ€™s Biggest Billboard Hot 100 Hits: â€˜Kryptoniteâ€™ &Â More
items.summary: A look at the bandâ€™s most key singles on the survey.
items.body: 3 Doors Down dominated Billboard â€™s rock charts in the 2000s and beyond, also crossing to pop formats and the upper reaches of the Billboard Hot 100 . As previously reported, Brad Arnold , a founding member and lead singer of the band, died on Feb. 7 following a battle with cancer. He was 47. â€œBrad helped redefine mainstream rock, blending post-grunge accessibility with emotionally direct songwriting and lyrical themes that resonated with everyday listeners,â€ the group shared in a statement. Related Brad Arnold, 3 Doors Down Lead Singer, Dies at 47 After Cancer Battle 3 Doors Down made its Billboard chart debut on Jan. 29, 2000, and went on to achieve five No. 1s among 13 top 10s through 2016 on the Mainstream Rock Airplay chart. â€œLoserâ€ led for 21 weeks in 2000-01 â€” the longest command in the listâ€™s history, which dates to 1981. On Alternative Airplay, the band has tallied four top 10s, including â€œKryptonite,â€ which ruled the ranking for 11 weeks in 2000. The actâ€™s combination of crunch and melody clicked with mainstream audiences, with three of its hits topping the Pop Airplay chart, among five top 10s: â€œKryptoniteâ€ (for five weeks in 2000), â€œWhen Iâ€™m Goneâ€ (one week, â€¦

items.title: How to Watch Super Bowl LX & Bad Bunnyâ€™s Halftime Show Online forÂ Free
items.summary: From the Super Bowl to the Benito Bowl, here's everything you need to know about NFL's big night.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. What a year it’s already been for Bad Bunny , from winning Album of the Year at the Grammys, to becoming the most streamed artists in the world, to dropping the best 2026 Super Bowl LX merch and now performing at the halftime show for NFL’s biggest night. With fans dubbing the special event “Benito Bowl,” the Puerto Rican star is set to make history today, Sunday (Feb. 8), which is now officially “Bad Bunny Day” in California, as he’ll be the first artist to perform primarily in Spanish while headlining the show. We don’t know exactly what surprises he has in store for fans, but Bad Bunny has teased that the halftime show “will be a huge party.” Pre- and post-Benito Bowl, there’s also an epic football gaming happening as well. The New England Patriots will face the Seattle Seahawks in an exciting Super Bowl XLIX rematch from 2015. How to Watch Super Bowl LX, At a Glance Kickoff Time: â€¦

items.title: Ireland let Sri Lanka off the hook at World Cup
items.summary: Ireland cannot overcome a host of errors in the field as they fall 20 runs short of co-hosts Sri Lanka in their World Cup opener.

items.title: Saracens thrash Leicester as Quins and Exeter draw
items.summary: Saracens score 13 tries in an 81-0 thrashing of Leicester Tigers to keep up the pressure on Gloucester-Hartpury at the top of the Premiership Women's table.

items.title: Chelsea see off Tottenham to move third in WSL
items.summary: Goals from Keira Walsh and Alyssa Thompson ease Chelsea to a 2-0 victory over Tottenham to move the Blues third in the WSL.

items.title: Vonn undergoes surgery on leg fracture after crash
items.summary: American superstar skier Lindsey Vonn "deserved a better ending" after suffering heartbreak in what could be her final Olympic event as she crashes in the women's downhill competition in Cortina.

items.title: 'Catalogue of errors' as Ireland drop several catches against Sri Lanka
items.summary: Ireland drop multiple catches in a poor fielding display against Sri Lanka in their opening game at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

items.title: An almighty scare - but are England learning?
items.summary: Why some subtle signs suggest, despite their scare against Nepal in the T20 World Cup, England might be learning under Harry Brook and Brendon McCullum.

items.title: Reed continues fine form with Qatar Masters win
items.summary: American Patrick Reed continues his fine form on the DP World Tour with victory at the Qatar Masters by two shots over Scotland's Calum Hill.

items.title: Sussex chairman quits in wake of points deductions
items.summary: Sussex chairman Jon Filby resigns in the wake of the county's financial difficulties, which have left them facing points deductions for next season.

items.title: GB's curlers beat hosts Italy to top standings
items.summary: Bruce Mouat and Jen Dodds bounce back from their first defeat in the mixed doubles curling to record an eighth win that confirms they will finish top of the standings going into the semi-finals.

items.title: Zhao wins all-Chinese World Grand Prix final
items.summary: Zhao Xintong beats Chinese compatriot Zhang Anda 10-6 to win the World Grand Prix - his first ranking title since being crowned world champion last May.

items.title: England deny Nepal in final-ball World Cup thriller
items.summary: England fight from the brink to avoid a major shock and beat an inspired Nepal by four runs in their opening match of the T20 World Cup in Mumbai.

items.title: England survive scare to beat Nepal in World Cup thriller
items.summary: Will Jacks' late flurry of 39 runs off 18 balls proved to be key as England narrowly avoid a shocking upset against minnows Nepal, winning by four runs in their opening game of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

items.title: Vonn crashes out of Winter Olympics downhill
items.summary: American skier Lindsey Vonn crashes in the women's downhill competition at the Winter Olympics, nine days after rupturing her left anterior cruciate ligament.

items.title: Pakistan officials meet ICC over India boycott
items.summary: Officials from the ICC and the PCB will meet in Lahore on Sunday for talks over Pakistan's planned boycott of their T20 World Cup match against India.

items.title: 'The shirt used to weigh heavy - now England players double in size in it'
items.summary: World Cup winner Matt Dawson discusses England's seven-try thrashing of Wales and the lessons coach Steve Borthwick can learn from France.

items.title: Rockers Pay Tribute to 3 Doors Down Frontman BradÂ Arnold
items.summary: The 3 Doors Down frontman died Saturday (Feb. 7) at age 47 after a battle with stage 4 kidney cancer.
items.body: Tributes from across the rock world have poured in following the death of Brad Arnold , the frontman of 3 Doors Down, who died Saturday (Feb. 7) at age 47 after a battle with stage 4 kidney cancer. Related 3 Doors Downâ€™s Biggest Billboard Hot 100 Hits: â€˜Kryptoniteâ€™ & More Brad Arnold, 3 Doors Down Lead Singer, Dies at 47 After Cancer Battle 'Bad Bunny Day' Declared by Gavin Newsom Ahead of Super Bowl LX Arnoldâ€™s death was confirmed earlier in the day by the rock group via social media, prompting messages of remembrance from fellow musicians who toured alongside him during the peak of post-grunge and hard rockâ€™s commercial dominance in the early 2000s. View this post on Instagram Among the first to publicly pay tribute was Brent Smith of Shinedown, who shared a video message recalling how 3 Doors Down helped his band early in their career. â€œYou guys were the first band that ever took us out on the road,â€ Smith said, referencing Shinedownâ€™s opening slot for 3 Doors Down in 2003. â€œBrad was always kind, always encouraging, and always real.â€ He captioned the post: “Thank you for the music. Thank you for the songs. Thank you for your love. Thank you for youâ€¦

items.title: Rockets' Sengun sorry for sexist remark at official
items.summary: Houston Rockets centre Alperen Sengun says he has apologised to the female official he aimed a sexist remark at during a defeat by the Boston Celtics.

items.title: Same old story for sorry Wales in Six Nations
items.summary: Wales' 12th consecutive Six Nations loss in a run dating back to 2023 is more evidence of how far they have fallen.

items.title: The new top-flight Canadian club inspired by Athletic Bilbao
items.summary: Supra du Quebec kick off their inaugural Canadian Premier League in April and will field only players born or raised in the province.

items.title: How Ekitike has already become a Liverpool cult hero
items.summary: Inside the rise of Hugo Ekitike, adapting to life in England, connecting with Florian Wirtz and why he's already a fan favourite.

items.title: Super Bowl countdown almost over as Patriots to face Seahawks
items.summary: After a week of frenzied build-up in the San Francisco Bay Area, Super Bowl 60 - America's biggest game - takes place on Sunday night.

items.title: â€˜Bad Bunny Dayâ€™ Declared by Gavin Newsom Ahead of Super BowlÂ LX
items.summary: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has officially declared Feb. 8 â€œBad Bunny Dayâ€ across the state ahead of the singer's halftime performance.
items.body: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has officially declared Feb. 8 â€œ Bad Bunny Day â€ across the state, coinciding with Bad Bunnyâ€™s upcoming Super Bowl LX halftime performance in Santa Clara. â€œI am declaring tomorrow in California as â€˜Bad Bunny Dayâ€™ when Bad Bunny performs at the big game in the Golden State with his soothing, beautiful voice, and his very nice looks,â€ Newsom said via X on Saturday. Newsom later amplified his support with a tongue-in-cheek follow-up message, describing himself as â€œa tremendous lover of the Spanishâ€ and â€œa huge fan of Puerto Rico,â€ before adding, â€œWe love Bad Bunny! He is nearly as â€˜hotâ€™ as me â€” which is a big compliment, because there is nobody hotter. Happy Bad Bunny Day, America.â€ Support also came from Tim Cook, who praised the artist on social media ahead of the game in a selfie with the singer to social media. Bad Bunny, born Benito Antonio MartÃ­nez Ocasio, is set to deliver an all-Spanish halftime performance at Leviâ€™s Stadium during Super Bowl LX, marking one of the most prominent Spanish-language showcases in the eventâ€™s history. The appearance follows a landmark year for the Puerto Rican artist, who recently won Album of the Year at the 2026 Gramâ€¦

items.title: Backstreet Boys Share Bloopers, Behind-the-Scenes Video From T-Mobile Super BowlÂ Commercial
items.summary: The group chatted with Billboard ahead of the Super Bowl Sunday ad.
items.body: The Backstreet Boys bring a fun, reimagined version of “I Want It That Way” to T-Mobile’s 2026 Super Bowl commercial, which they filmed in New York City with a snowstorm looming. Related Backstreet Boys Warm Up to Sing on TV for Super Bowl Sunday in New Ad Teaser: ‘We’re So Back’ Inside the 2026 Super Bowl Parties: J Balvin, Diplo, Green Day & More Bad Bunny Ahead of Super Bowl: â€˜Iâ€™m Just a Normal Guy That Makes Musicâ€™ “We were hit with the winter storm right at the exact same time we were supposed to start filming,” BSB’s Nick Carter revealed in an interview with Billboard â€™s Tetris Kelly, noting, “There was a lot of adjustments that were being made at the time because we were supposed to do a two-day shoot.” That two-day schedule was condensed into one long day on set in the city at T-Mobile’s store in Times Square, where Carter says the temperature dropped to about six degrees, with snow imminent: “There’s a state of emergency basically in the city … The inside of the store was freezing. So every time that they opened the door it was like a wind tunnel, or like a refrigeâ€¦

items.title: England make flying start with convincing win over poor Wales
items.summary: Watch highlights as a hat-trick from Henry Arundell helps England dominate a disappointing Wales side in their opening Six Nations match.

items.title: Real Madrid step up Rodri interest - Sunday's gossip
items.summary: Real Madrid are stepping up interest in Manchester City midfielder Rodri, Arsenal are among clubs keen on Leon Goretzka and Manchester United and Newcastle target Michael Kayode, plus more.

items.title: 'Clutch' final jump gives Japan star big air snowboard gold
items.summary: Watch Japan's Kira Kimura win gold in the men's big air snowboarding final, as his last jump scores highest to beat compatriot Ryoma Kimata.

items.title: England's riot club focus on fine-tuning after walloping Wales
items.summary: Steve Borthwick has the pleasure of nit-picking through fine details after his England side swat aside Wales in their Six Nations opener.

items.title: Team GB skeleton helmet appeal dismissed by Cas
items.summary: The British skeleton team - among Team GB's best hopes for medals at the Winter Olympics - will not be able to wear their new helmets after the Court of Arbitration for Sport said they do not comply with the sport's rules around shape.

items.title: 'Townsend on the ropes after romp in swamp'
items.summary: Arguments for Gregor Townsend remaining as Scotland head coach are growing increasingly small after familiar failings lead to defeat in rainy Rome, writes Tom English.

items.title: I believe in what we're doing, says defiant Townsend
items.summary: Head coach Gregor Townsend insists he is still the man to lead Scotland despite a hugely dispiriting defeat by Italy in their Six Nations opener.

items.title: Suryakumar rescues India from all-time shock by USA
items.summary: Suryakumar Yadav rescues India from an almighty scare as T20 World Cup co-hosts beat the United States by 29 runs in Mumbai.

items.title: First gold of Games 'like a movie' for Von Allmen
items.summary: Swiss Alpine skier Franjo von Allmen becomes the first champion of the 2026 Winter Olympics in the downhill.

items.title: 'Can't live in the past' - Warren on boxing's future after 45 years as promoter
items.summary: After celebrating 45 years as a boxing promoter this year and a period of rapid change, Frank Warren expects more to come in the next decades.

items.title: Seahawks or Patriots? Expert Super Bowl 60 predictions and make your pick
items.summary: Will the Seattle Seahawks of New England Patriots win Super Bowl 60? Our BBC Sport experts have their say plus you can make your pick.

items.title: Some 'dark days and nights' at Arsenal, happiness at Sunderland
items.summary: Granit Xhaka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his motivation for joining Sunderland, and falling out with the Arsenal fans.
